Article Title: How a 44-year-old Noida woman lost Rs 27 lakh to eSIM fraud
Article Text:
How the scam happened

Scammers siphoned off Rs 27 lakh

A 44-year-old woman recently fell victim to an eSIM fraud , losing around Rs 27 lakh to the scamsters. A first information report (FIR) has been registered at cybercrime police station, Sector 36, Noida following the complaint. Police have registered a case under sections 318(4) (cheating) and 319 (2) (cheating by personation) of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita and IT Act on Thursday (September 5), reports HT.Jyotsana Bhatia, a resident of Sector 82 works at a private company.She told the police that she received a WhatsApp call on August 31 from an alleged customer care executive of a telecom company. The caller told her about new features of eSIM that should be activated in case her phone gets lost.Vijay Kumar Gautam, station house officer (SHO), cybercrime branch, said “The suspect asked Bhatia to select the eSIM feature in the SIM ’s application and enter a code received on the message. As she followed the suspect’s instruction, her mobile number was deactivated immediately”.Bhatia was assured that a new SIM will be delivered to her on September 1.“When she did not receive the SIM card on September 1, she dialled the customer care and was instructed to visit the service centre for a duplicate SIM,” the SHO added.Three days later, Bhatia got a new SIM, but received multiple messages from the bank, says the report.“The suspect broke my fixed deposit, siphoned off money from two bank accounts, and extended a loan of ₹7.40 lakh in my name without my knowledge,” she alleged in the FIR.According to the officer, the accused hanged her email ID to access her mobile banking via mobile number. “They siphoned off around ₹27 lakh in multiple transactions,” he added.
Article Summary: Jyotsana Bhatia received a WhatsApp call on August 31 from an alleged customer care executive of a telecom company. The caller told her about new features of eSIM that should be activated in case her phone gets lost. Police have registered a case under sections 318(4) and 319 (2) of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita.

Article Title: iOS 18 beta hints at new wireless earbuds with heart rate sensor
Article Text: A recent analysis of the iOS 18 beta code has revealed potential clues suggesting that Apple may be working on a new line of wireless earbuds equipped with a heart rate sensor.According to a report by AppleInsider , Apple's iOS 18 release candidate contains code suggesting that the company may be working on wireless earbuds with a heart rate sensor. "Wear both earbuds during workouts to track and send your heart rate to Apple Health .Manage in Bluetooth settings," the text reads.Heart rate monitoring is a popular feature in fitness trackers and smartwatches, but it is less common in wireless earbuds. If Apple were to introduce earbuds with a heart rate sensor, it could offer users a convenient and discreet way to track their heart rate during workouts or other activities.It remains to be seen whether Apple will ultimately decide to release wireless earbuds with a heart rate sensor. However, the discovery in the iOS 18 beta code suggests that this feature is under consideration and could potentially be introduced in the near future.Meanwhile, Apple has announced the release date for iOS 18 update. After the iPhone launch, the Cupertino-based tech giant announced the release date of its latest mobile operating system — iOS 18. The company has announced that the iOS 18 will be available for all compatible devices starting September 16.
Article Summary: A recent analysis of the iOS 18 beta code has revealed potential clues suggesting that Apple may be working on a new line of wireless earbuds equipped with a heart rate sensor. The iOS 18 will be available for all compatible devices starting September 16. Apple has announced the release date for iOS 18 update.

Article Title: iOS 18 brings new pause button for video recording
Article Text: Apple unveiled its iPhone 16 series and announced that the iOS 18 update will be available starting September 16. A key feature of this update is a new pause button for video recording, allowing users to stop and resume recording seamlessly. The iPhone 16 models will be available in stores from September 20.
Article Summary: The iPhone 16 models will be available in stores from September 20. A key feature of this update is a new pause button for video recording, allowing users to stop and resume recording seamlessly. Apple announced that the iOS 18 update will be Available starting September 16.

Article Title: Apple iPhone 16 launch event: 4 products that missed a ‘big refresh’ from Apple
Article Text: Apple's 'It’s Glowtime' event unveiled new iPhone 16 models along with Apple Watch Series 10 and AirPods 4. However, anticipated updates for the Apple Watch SE and Ultra series were not introduced. The AirPods Max gained new color options and USB-C support while the AirPods Pro 2 received health-related features without a major update.
Article Summary: Apple's 'It’s Glowtime' event unveiled new iPhone 16 models along with Apple Watch Series 10 and AirPods 4. However, anticipated updates for the Apple Watch SE and Ultra series were not introduced. The AirPPod Max gained new color options and USB-C support while the AirPod Pro 2 received health-related features without a major update.

Article Title: Why EU's $14.4 billion fine on Apple is a headache for Ireland
Article Text:
Reputational damage for Ireland

Ireland government's 'inflation worries'

The European Union 's (EU) recent ruling demanding Apple pay 13 billion euros ($14.4 billion) in back taxes has sparked mixed reactions in Ireland . While the government seeks to downplay the impact, the country faces concerns about its reputation as a corporate tax haven.Ireland has been a popular destination for multinational corporations (MNCs) due to its low tax rates.The government has vigorously defended its tax policies, arguing that they have contributed significantly to economic growth and job creation. However, the EU's ruling has challenged this narrative.The EU's ruling has raised questions about Ireland's reputation as a tax haven. While some experts believe that the damage is likely to be temporary, the case has highlighted the challenges of balancing economic growth with concerns about tax fairness. As Ireland continues to navigate these complexities, it will be crucial to maintain its attractiveness to foreign investors while addressing the concerns raised by international regulators.While the government has acknowledged the need to pay the back taxes, it has emphasized that the issue is largely a matter of historical significance due to changes in tax laws. Finance Minister Jack Chambers stated that the funds would be carefully considered for future use but would not be added to the upcoming budget.Despite the ruling, Ireland remains a highly attractive location for foreign investment. The country's corporate tax receipts have continued to surge, and it has established a sovereign wealth fund with ambitious growth targets. However, the government is cautious about increasing spending too rapidly, as it could fuel inflation.
Article Summary: Ireland has been a popular destination for multinational corporations (MNCs) due to its low tax rates. The government has vigorously defended its tax policies, arguing that they have contributed significantly to economic growth and job creation. Despite the ruling, Ireland remains a highly attractive location for foreign investment.

Article Title: Google announces 3 new features for Chrome users to help organise their tabs better
Article Text: Google has rolled out three new updates for its Chrome browser to assist users in managing multiple tabs. The updates include introducing tab groups for iPhones and iPads, syncing these groups across devices, and suggesting pages based on open tabs. These features are designed to improve user experience on phones, tablets, and PCs.
Article Summary: Google has rolled out three new updates for its Chrome browser. The updates include introducing tab groups for iPhones and iPads, syncing these groups across devices, and suggesting pages based on open tabs. These features are designed to improve user experience on phones, tablets, and PCs.

Article Title: India’s significance to Amazon cannot be overstated, says senior Amazon executive
Article Text:
The Indian market landscape

Amazon and AI

With the festive season’s onset, e-commerce platforms are gearing up with deals, discounts and offers. Amazon is one of them and over the years, its Prime service has become a household name. Abhinav Agarwal , director, Amazon Prime, India, said that keeping customer centricity at the core much like everything else at Amazon, Prime has also been designed to meet the evolving needs of customers.“At Prime, we remain focused on strengthening the Prime membership program by offering customised tiered plans at different price points to cater to different customer segments.,” he said.He said that Amazon will continue to make efforts to make “Prime the most loved membership in India which not only fulfils shopping & entertainment needs of our customers but also delivers value & savings along with other benefits.”It has been a strong year for Amazon Prime so far. In India, so far in 2024, nearly 50% of all Prime member orders across a wide selection of products from eyeliners to baby products, to garden tools, to watches, to phones, have arrived the next day, same-day, or faster.Amazon’s fulfilment centres provide storage space to lakhs of sellers across 15 states. Furthermore, it has sortation centres across 19 states working with over 1,950 delivery stations operated by Amazon and local entrepreneurs. It also has 28,000 third-party delivery partners to deliver products and it delivers to 100% serviceable pin codes.India is a challenging market and the landscape of customer expectations in India is unique and dynamic. “ To effectively navigate this diverse market, the key lies in adapting customer experience strategies to align with the distinctive needs and preferences of the various customer cohorts,” says Agarwal. Another crucial pillar involves regional customization, recognizing differences in language, preferences, and shopping behaviour across different parts of the country, said Agarwal.India is one of the top priority markets for Amazon it offers an extensive catalogue of over 10-lakh items for same-day delivery and 40-lakh items for next-day delivery. “A pivotal aspect of our operational strategy in India has been regionalisation—tailoring our network to the unique geographical & demographical dynamics of the country,” he added.Furthermore, he said that the company’s experiences in India have not only shaped it approach to member communication and customer experience but “have also informed our strategies in other key markets such as the Middle East and Latin America.”India serves as a wellspring of innovation that reverberates globally, inspiring us to continually refine and innovate our services for our customers worldwide. Thus, the significance of our country cannot be overstated—it serves as a catalyst for innovation and progress on a global scale.We live in the era of AI and at an organisational, Amazon employs a comprehensive approach to understand its customers by integrating Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML). These initiatives aim to enhance the overall customer experience, prioritising inclusivity and personalisation.Amazon has been tapping into AI for Prime, says Agarwal. “With the help of AI, we’ve been able to serve customers faster at scale. We’ve leveraged the power of machine learning to expand our selection of products, bring them closer to customers, and stock more everyday essentials that our customers order and re-order consistently,” he said.Agarwal says that Amazon's ML-powered personalisation approach goes beyond mere product recommendations, delving into a deeper understanding of customer proficiency, and leveraging it to provide customers with an adaptive experience. “Amazon's ML model leverages user session features, such as browse patterns and search query frequency, to predict customer proficiency. By understanding customer proficiency, Amazon elevates the e-commerce experience, driving both customer satisfaction and business growth,” he added.
Article Summary: Amazon has been tapping into AI for Prime, says Abhinav Agarwal, director, Amazon Prime, India. India is one of the top priority markets for Amazon. It offers an extensive catalogue of over 10-lakh items for same-day delivery.

The widely popular Telegram-based crypto tap-to-earn game has just revealed the code word and card combinations that could earn you up to 6 million tokens for free.Since its launch in March 2024, Hamster Kombat has seen explosive growth, attracting over 200 million users globally. The viral clicker game centers around a Hamster who acts as the CEO of a simulated virtual crypto exchange.Players are tasked with supporting this ambitious rodent by mining coins and upgrading the exchange’s level.As a reward for their efforts, players can earn free bonuses. Mining in Hamster Kombat is simple—just tap on the Hamster icon until your energy bar is depleted.The Daily Cipher Code and Combo Card are special challenges within the game designed to reward players with even more tokens. The Daily Cipher Code is a task where players must decipher a word using Morse code. Successfully cracking the code within the 24-hour time limit can earn you 1 million coins.The Daily Combo Card is a challenge that requires players to correctly choose three cards from the game’s upgrade categories: PR & Team, Markets, Legal, Specials, and Web3. Completing this challenge can net you an additional 5 million coins. Like the Cipher Code, the Combo Card is updated daily.The Hamster Kombat Daily Cipher code for today is “260924” Enter the code using the Morse sheet given below and earn up to 1 million coins.▬ Long Tap● Short TapToday's special cars was "A pair of skis"

Article Title: Did Pavel Durov went under the knife? His transformation raises eyebrows
Article Text:
Pavel Durov's rise to fame

Durov's recent legal troubles

Pavel Durov’s transformation: Then vs. Now

Social media reactions on Durov’s transformation

Impact of public scrutiny

Also read

Pavel Durov, CEO of Telegram , has recently become the subject of widespread speculation after older photos of him resurfaced online. These images have led many to wonder whether the billionaire entrepreneur underwent plastic surgery to enhance his appearance. Adding to the intrigue, Durov was recently arrested in France, raising further questions about the man behind the popular messaging app.Pavel Durov, a 39-year-old entrepreneur originally from Russia, is best known as the founder and CEO of Telegram, a messaging app launched in 2013.Telegram quickly gained popularity for its strong emphasis on user privacy, offering end-to-end encryption and other security features that set it apart from competitors. As of now, Forbes estimates Durov's net worth to be around $15.5 billion. Despite his success in the tech industry, Durov has managed to maintain a relatively low profile—until now.Durov's recent arrest in Paris has added a new layer of complexity to his public image. He was detained in France on charges of suspected complicity in running an online platform involved in illicit activities, including child exploitation, drug trafficking, and fraud. While these allegations are serious, it is the sudden focus on Durov's physical transformation that has captured the internet's attention.Pavel Durov has been active on social media platforms like Instagram since 2011, regularly sharing photos from his travels around the world. In his recent posts, Durov appears with a full head of hair and a toned physique, often posing shirtless in various locations. However, these recent images stand in stark contrast to older photos where Durov was seen with a noticeably receding hairline.The drastic change in his appearance has fueled rumours that Durov may have undergone plastic surgery, including a possible hair transplant. A popular post on X (formerly Twitter) by a well-known account shared a side-by-side comparison of Durov's old and new photos, sparking a flurry of online discussions. The post reads, "Pavel Durov (Telegram CEO) before his hair transplant and plastic surgery," and has since gone viral.The speculation around Durov's transformation has been met with a variety of opinions online. On Reddit, users have debated whether the changes in Durov's appearance are the result of surgical procedures or simply better grooming and styling.One Reddit user commented, "This isn't a hair transplant. His hair is too thick and full to have this kind of drastic change from a HT. Most likely he's wearing a hair system (wig)."Another user added, "There's speculation that it's not a transplant, but rather a hair system because his hair loss was much more advanced in the first picture, so when the operation happens, the resulting hairdo never looks as full as his."Some users believe the changes are the result of plastic surgery, with one theorising, "This is well-done surgery."However, not everyone is convinced that surgery is involved. One Reddit user opined, "Honestly, I think a lot of the facial 'changes' are simply due to the much better angle and lighting in the second photo."As the speculation continues, it's clear that Durov's transformation—whether natural or assisted—has caught the public's eye. The intense scrutiny of his appearance highlights the challenges that come with being in the spotlight, especially for someone as private as Durov. Whether or not he has undergone any procedures, the discussions around his looks reflect a broader societal fascination with image and success.
Article Summary: Pavel Durov, 39, is the founder and CEO of Telegram, a messaging app launched in 2013. He has recently become the subject of widespread speculation after older photos of him resurfaced online. These images have led many to wonder whether the billionaire entrepreneur underwent plastic surgery to enhance his appearance.

The primary objective of the game is to build and upgrade villages, while simultaneously attacking and defending against those belonging to other players, including your friends.To excel in Coin Master, players must effectively defend their villages, collect rewards, and progress quickly.The game's core mechanic revolves around a virtual slot machine that awards players with various rewards, including coins, shields, and weapons. In Coin Master, characters embark on time-travelling adventures, adopting roles such as pirates, hippies, kings, warriors, and Vikings, among others.Players accumulate spins, which can be used to earn rewards such as coins, shields, and opportunities to attack or raid other players' villages. Here’s what you can expect from the slot machine:Players can also perform a "Super Bet," wagering multiple spins simultaneously for potentially greater rewards.Players can also earn spins and coins by collecting thematic cards to complete collections, which unlock rewards like pets, spins, and coins; card collection begins at the third village, and cards can be traded with friends to complete sets faster.Pets, including Foxy (increases raid rewards), Rhino (enhances village defence), and Tiger (boosts attack rewards), play a key role by offering various bonuses as they level up. To maintain pets, players need to provide food, which can be obtained from the store, special events, or the slot machine.Spins are crucial in Coin Master as they enable participation in the slot machine. Once this is complete, a display box will appear showing the number of links and coins you will receive.Click the green "Collect" button, and all freebies will be added to your in-game inventory.
Article Summary: Coin Master is a popular mobile game available for free on both Android and iOS platforms. The primary objective of the game is to build and upgrade villages, while simultaneously attacking and defending against those belonging to other players, including your friends. The game's core mechanic revolves around a virtual slot machine that awards players with various rewards, including coins, shields, and weapons.

Article Title: When Tesla CEO Elon Musk called Ratan Tata a “gentleman and …”
Article Text:
Tata Nano and the Indian automobile market

Elon Musk praised Ratan Tata

The legacy of the Tata Nano

Also read

In the realm of business and innovation, few figures command as much respect as Tata Group chairman emeritus Ratan Tata. His influence extends far beyond the Indian corporate world, even garnering admiration from Tesla CEO and X owner Elon Musk . In a 2009 interview with American journalist Charlie Rose , Musk praised Ratan Tata as a "gentleman and a scholar." This moment has recently resurfaced, shedding light on Musk's appreciation for Ratan Tata and his ambitious project, the Tata Nano .The Tata Nano was introduced by Tata Motors in 2008 as the world's cheapest car, with a price tag of just Rs 1 lakh (approximately $2,300 at the time). The car was a pet project of Ratan Tata, designed to make automobile ownership accessible to millions of Indians who had never been able to afford a car. The idea was revolutionary—a small, affordable car that would cater to the vast Indian middle class, providing them with a safe and efficient means of transportation.In the interview with Charlie Rose, which took place shortly after the launch of the Tata Nano, the Tesla CEO was asked about his views on Ratan Tata’s efforts to introduce a low-cost car in India. The interview clip, which has recently gone viral, captures Musk's candid response."Take for a moment Ratan Tata, what he’s doing in India — developing a little sedan for $2300. Where do you put that in the whole equation of where the future of cars is?" asked Rose.Musk responded with a mix of admiration and caution. He began by acknowledging the brilliance behind the Tata Nano project and the character of Ratan Tata himself."I think it's a good idea to have affordable cars, but I think the problem with something like the Nano ... I wouldn't say problem because I think, by the way, it is probably a great idea and Ratan is a gentleman and scholar," Musk said.However, Musk also expressed his concerns about the long-term viability of such a low-cost vehicle, particularly in the context of rising fuel prices. He pointed out that while the initial purchase cost of the Nano was remarkably low, the cost of running the car—particularly fuel costs—could become a significant issue as gasoline prices continued to rise."But where it’s going to become challenging in the future is when the price of gasoline rises, the cost of acquiring the car is much less of an issue than the cost of running the car," the billionnaire explained.Despite the initial excitement surrounding the Tata Nano, the car faced numerous challenges. One of the most significant issues was its branding. While the Nano was intended to be an affordable vehicle for the masses, it was often labeled as "cheap" rather than "affordable." This perception problem, combined with safety concerns and competition from other small cars, led to unimpressive sales figures.The Nano’s production was ultimately discontinued in 2018, marking the end of what was initially seen as a groundbreaking project. The car's journey from inception to discontinuation is often cited as one of the biggest marketing failures in the automobile industry.
Article Summary: The Tata Nano was introduced by Tata Motors in 2008 as the world's cheapest car, with a price tag of just Rs 1 lakh (approximately $2,300 at the time) The car was a pet project of Ratan Tata, designed to make automobile ownership accessible to millions of Indians who had never been able to afford a car. In a 2009 interview with American journalist Charlie Rose, Musk praised Tata as a "gentleman and a scholar"

Article Title: Donald Trump has found a role for Elon Musk in the US government
Article Text: Donald Trump announced his intention to form a government efficiency commission with Elon Musk as its head if he is elected President. The commission will audit the federal government to identify and eliminate fraud and improper payments. Trump also outlined proposals to cut regulations, boost energy production, adopt cryptocurrencies, and reduce corporate taxes for US-based companies.
Article Summary: The commission will audit the federal government to identify and eliminate fraud and improper payments. Trump also outlined proposals to cut regulations, boost energy production, adopt cryptocurrencies, and reduce corporate taxes for US- based companies. The commission will be headed by Elon Musk if he is elected President.

Article Title: Bengaluru-based Dunzo lays off 75% employees, reduces workforce to 50
Article Text:
Dunzo sends email to employees

Reliance Retail-backed Dunzo has laid off 75% of its workforce, reports Financial Express. Citing unknown sources aware of the matter, the report said that the online delivery app now has 50 employees in its core supply and marketplace teams.The job cuts , according to the report, is part of the company's broader effort to curb costs and create cash flow to address mounting liabilities, including overdue salaries to current and former employees and outstanding vendor payments. Layoffs .fyi - the online tracker show that the job cuts were made on August 31, 2024.As per the report, Dunzo has sent an email to its employees informing them about the recent downsizing. In the letter, Dunzo promises to pay pending salaries, severance, leave encashment, and other dues to affected staff as soon as it secures the necessary funds.Dunzo, which started as a concierge service, has undergone multiple shifts and challenges. The company, once valued at $775 million, has been struggling to close a critical funding round. In May this year, Dunzo was reportedly close to securing $22-25 million through a mix of equity and debt from both new and existing investors.In mid-July this year, the company informed its employees that it was in the final stages of closing a deal, expecting to settle dues within 10-15 days. However, the transaction failed to materialize with subsequent emails revealing persistent delays and challenges.The company is now seeking to diversify its revenue sources beyond its primary merchant-focused operations.
Article Summary: Reliance Retail-backed Dunzo has laid off 75% of its workforce, reports Financial Express. The online delivery app now has 50 employees in its core supply and marketplace teams. The company, once valued at $775 million, has been struggling to close a critical funding round.

Article Title: Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal slams Elon Musk’ X: “just look at Twitter’s arm twisting of the Brazilian Supreme Court”
Article Text:
Take a look at Bhavish Aggarwal’s post on X

Elon Musk criticizes Brazil ban on X



Delhi High Court warns Wikipedia

Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal has once again reiterated his stance on fostering the Indian technology sector. Aggarwal took to microblogging site X (formerly known as Twitter) to share his views on the latest report of Delhi High Court slamming Wikipedia over non-compliance with Indian laws.In the post, he wrote “Another proof of why we need to build our tech stack in India. These platforms don’t even comply with Indian laws and then even ignore court judgements!”.But he did not stop there.Aggarwal took aim at Elon Musk 's social media platform, Twitter, leveraging the Wikipedia incident to slam the platform. He said “Also, just look at Twitter’s arm twisting of the Brazilian Supreme Court .”“The more we ignore and justify, more we risk,” he further added.Recently, Brazil Supreme Court banned X after a protracted legal battle. The battle started in April this year when Judge de Moraes directed X to suspend several accounts alleged to be disseminating false information. X's refusal to follow this order resulted in the current suspension in addition to a penalty of 50,000 reais (approximately Rs. 7.47 lakh) for any efforts to bypass the ban, including the use of VPNs.Elon Musk reacted to the announcement with fury, dubbing Moraes as ‘evil dictator’.The Delhi High Court threatened Wikipedia to block the website if it doesn’t comply with India’s laws. Justice Navin Chawla delivered the warning during a hearing related to a defamation case filed by news agency ANI against Wikipedia."If you don't like India, please don't work in India... We will ask government to block your site," Justice Chawla declared, as reported by legal news website Bar and Bench.
Article Summary: Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal took to X (formerly known as Twitter) to share his views on the latest report of Delhi High Court slamming Wikipedia over non- compliance with Indian laws. He also took aim at Elon Musk's social media platform, Twitter, leveraging the Wikipedia incident.
